item.title: Making Footnotes
item.description: I like footnotes 1. Part of the blame for this has to lay with Terry Pratchett and his Discworld novels. Pratchett had a propensity for adding footnotes to his stories to, occasionally, add details to a line but, most often, to continue a joke or to sometimes ramble on for a half page.

item.title: Markdown writing tools
item.description: Since starting to write using Markdown it has become, as I have commented, an obsession with me. I currently use Nota to write and organize all of my work and while it is quite good it doesn’t have everything that I want. Primarily, it currently doesn’t have any Shortcuts or AppleScript support which makes plugging it into an automated workflow trickier than needed.

item.title: Writing with Markdown
item.description: Some time ago I started doing most of my writing using Markdown. Almost everything I write end up online, either in a blog or website, and so it made sense to use a formatting system that was web-friendly. The more I used it though the more I wanted to use it everywhere.
